description: I am a software engineer and entrepreneur with a deep understanding of web technology and a keen eye for quality in software development, from user experience to coding. My diverse experiences have taken me through research, scale-ups, start-ups, and both public and private entrepreneurship.

experiences.title: Senior Software Engineer
facts: Transfer of Compwise features inside Lucca's products

experiences.title: Co-founder & CTO
experiences.body: Compwise is a platform for managing compensation policy.
facts: Fast execution, ideation to MVP: 1 month.
100+ user interviews done with HRs, CFOs, and CEOs.
Design, architecture and implementation of the different versions of the platform.
100 000+ employee salary data collected to build our benchmark.
200 companies in free trial / 5 companies in paying plans.

experiences.title: Founder in Residence
facts: €100k investment to support the growth of Compwise

experiences.title: Senior Software Engineer
facts: Internationalization of the chrome extension and the web app.
Conducting fit and technical interviews for new engineers.

experiences.title: Senior Software Engineer
experiences.body: Mindmesh is an early stage international startup based in Boston and Paris which develop a productivity webapp for product managers.
facts: User research with the CEO and the CTO.
Implementation of successive MVPs (3 pivots).
Migration of the drive/slack/jira integrations from Python to Typescript fully typed.
Migration of the rich text editor framework from Draft.js to Plate and open source contributions.
Data visualization with D3.js.
Enforce good practice (introduce strict Typescript option and linter in an existing codebase, code review).

experiences.title: Software Engineer
experiences.body: Inside the program "Entrepreneur d'Intérêt général", I worked in the Court of Cassation to open justice data.
facts: Conducted over 40 user interviews. Weekly meeting with the Court of Cassation's executive officers to set up the roadmap.

facts.value: Inside a pluridisciplinary team of 4 people, I led the design and the architecture of an open source application, LABEL, to annotate and anonymize justice decisions

facts: Mentoring around software quality.
First MVP released in 3 months.
Best software development practices: mono-repository, high test coverage, strict typing, containerization.
Used by 20 public agents daily, this new tool increased the number of annotated justice decisions per user and per day from 15 to 100.
Succeeded handover, the project is still under active development.

experiences.title: Software Engineer
facts: Design, development, and production launch of the integrations to third party online courses platforms (Coursera, LinkedIn Learning, Udemy, Edx,...). Thousands of courses were synchronized daily.
Redesign of the architecture of the connectors to the APIs. The time to develop a new connector for a new third party platform went down from 1 month of work to 2 days with a complete test coverage.
More than 30 technical interviews realized for the the recruiting process of other software engineers.

experiences.title: Research Intern
facts: Automatic memory consumption analysis of program with static analysis.

facts.value: Implemention a functional prototype for a subset of the OCaml language
Design and development of an open source lock-free data structure library. A lock-free data structure is a data structure which can be used safely without lock or "mutex" in a parallel environment
Development of a web application implementing algorithms for projecting greenhouse gas consumption, constrained by different scenarios from the COP21.

studies.description: My studies focused on functional programming, compiler design, cryptography, networking and software engineering.
